sentence.Network_en: 'Good,'said Syme abstractedly, without looking up from his strip of paper.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 好呀, ”赛姆还看着纸条儿,头也不抬,一面心不在焉地说了一句.

sentence.Network_en: Winston gazed abstractedly through the muslin curtain.
sentence.Network_cn: 温斯顿透过薄纱窗帘,心不在焉地盯着窗外.

entry.def: Someone who is abstracted is thinking so deeply that they are not fully aware of what is happening around them.

example.ex: Meg was so abstracted she scarcely noticed that the train had stopped...
example.tran: 梅格想得出了神，几乎没有注意到火车已经停了。

example.ex: The same abstracted look was still on his face.

means.word_mean: 1. in an absent-minded or preoccupied manner;

auth_sentence.content: Many mourners ponder, even if only abstractedly, their reason for living.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many mourners ponder, even if only abstractedly, their reason for living.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many mourners ponder, even if only abstractedly, their reason for living.

auth_sentence.content: The girl and the boy ate melon abstractedly while their pleasure was weighed against their safety.
auth_sentence.res_content: The girl and the boy ate melon abstractedly while their pleasure was weighed against their safety.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The girl and the boy ate melon abstractedly while their pleasure was weighed against their safety.
